casebody.data:
NC STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION
v.
The STATE of NC, et al. 110PA16-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. January 22, 2018 Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for The North Carolina Rules Review Commission. Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, for The State of North Carolina. Robert F. Orr, Attorney at Law, Asheville, Andrew H. Erteschik, Attorney at Law, Saad Gul, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, John Michael Durnovich, Attorney at Law, for North Carolina State Board of Education. Christopher G. Smith, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Andrew Ellen, Attorney at Law, Taylor M. Dewberry, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Chamber Legal Institute, et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 16th of January 2018 by North Carolina Chamber Legal Institute, North Carolina Retail Merchants Association, and North Carolina Home Builders Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of January 2018."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
